page.title: 11O.S. Area 4141-3839
page.content: This area is mainly farmland, with a fairly large wood in the North West and some woodland in the North East. The most intresting aspect in Becca Hall (for further information see page 14) in the North East. The farmland is a mixture of crops (oats, potatoes, sugar beet, barley and hay) and livestock (cattle and sheep). The woods are largely deciduous. In the North is Becca Hall Farm, consisting of three houses and 10 outbuildings. It is owned by F.W. and R.Q. Richmond and is over 50 years old. Eight people live on the farm. On the road joining Becca Hall Farm to Becca Hall there are 3 private houses. A public footpath runs from the North West to the South East of the section.
